page.title: 18The Village Shop.
page.content: The shop has been in Upper Dicker since 1844.When Mr. and Mrs. Carr took over in 1977 they added 3 refrigerators and a new floor.Seventy percent of the population has changed. There used to be another shop called Hentie's Store,opposite St. Bede's, which has now added 300 to the village population.Customers come from within a 3 mile radius to buy food and use the Post Office.The Social Services are in constant touch with the shop because of deliveries to the old and immobile within the area.Mr.Carr travels to Arlington to deliver groceries and pension to an old man who lives alone and cannot walk.St. Bede's pupils use the village shop as a tuck shop and buy drinks,sweets etc.If the shop disappears many old people will suffer.A government organisation, COSIRA may help.
